column4: Hey guys, I'm having a problem with my Grub. I installed Startup-Manager and tweaked some graphics settings but I think I screwed it up. The Ubuntu logo renders in a hard-to-describe ugly way and it gies me an error.
Error says "vga=769 is deprecated. Use set gfxpayload=640x480x8,640x480 before linux command instead."
Then instead add a line like the example gfxpayload= to /etc/grub.d/40_custom
I don't see a vga= line in /etc/default/grub
You should also file a bug report against Startup Manager
Should I add the gfxpayload where vga=769 was?
Would you mind filing a bug report against Startup Manager?
Thank you, bug reporting is a very important contribution.
You could try asking in #grub but it might be an issue with usplash rather than your grub configuration
